message: Hello there. Should you be here? This is a tavern, you know. The Foaming Flask, to be precise.

replies.text: Who are you?

message: I am a member of the royal guard patrol from Feygard.

replies.text: Feygard, where is that?
What do you do around here?

message: Go talk to the captain inside if you want to talk. I must stay alert on my post.

replies.text: Ok. Goodbye.
Why must you stay alert outside a tavern?

message: Really, I cannot talk to you. I could get into trouble.

replies.text: Ok. I won't bother you anymore. Shadow be with you.
Ok. I won't bother you anymore. Goodbye.
What trouble?

message: No really, the captain might see me. I must be aware on my post at all times. *sigh*

replies.text: Ok. I won't bother you anymore. Shadow be with you.
Ok. I won't bother you anymore. Goodbye.
Do you like your job here?

message: My job? I guess the royal guard is ok. I mean, Feygard is a really nice place to live in.

replies.text: N

message: Standing guard on duty out here in the middle of nowhere is not really what I signed up for.

replies.text: I bet. This place is really boring.
You must get tired of just standing here also.

message: Yeah I know. I would rather be inside in the tavern drinking like the senior officers and the captain. How come I have to stand out here?

replies.text: At least the Shadow watches over you.
Why not just leave if it's not what you want to do?
The greater cause of the royal guard, to keep the peace, is worth it in the long run.

message: Yes, you are right of course. Our duty is to Feygard and to keep the peace from all that want to disrupt it.

replies.text: Yes. The Shadow will not look favorably upon those that disrupt the peace.
Yes. The troublemakers should be punished.

message: No, my loyalty is to Feygard. If I would leave, I would also leave my loyalty behind.

replies.text: What does that mean if you are not satisfied with what you do?
Yes, that sounds right. Feygard sounds like a nice place from what I have heard.

message: Right. I like you, kid. Tell you what, I could put in a good word for you in the barracks when we get back to Feygard if you want.

replies.text: Sure, that sounds good to me.
No thanks. I have enough to do already.

message: Well, I am convinced that we must follow the laws laid down by our rulers. If we don't obey the law, what are we left with?

replies.text: N

message:
Chaos. Disorder.

No, I prefer the lawful way of Feygard. My loyalty is firm.

replies.text: Sounds good to me. Laws are made to be followed.
I do not agree. We should follow our heart, even if that goes against the rules.

message: Was there anything else you wanted?

replies.text: I was wondering about why you stand guard here.

message: That troubles me. We might see each other again in the future. But then we might not be able to have this kind of civil discussion.
Right, we went over this before. As I said, I would rather be inside by the fire.

replies.text: I could spot for you if you want to go inside.
Tough luck. I guess you are left out here, while your captain and buddies are inside.

message: Yeah, that's just my luck.
Really? Yes that would be great. Then I can at least get something to eat and a bit of warmth from the fire.

replies.text: N

message: I will go inside in a minute. Will you stand watch while I go inside?

replies.text: Sure, I will do that.
[Lie] Sure, I will do that.

message: Thanks a lot my friend.
Shadow? How curious that you would mention that. Explain yourself!

replies.text: I did not mean a thing by it. Never mind I said anything.
The Shadow watches over us when we sleep.

message: Good. Now be gone before I will have to deal with you.
What? Are you one of those troublemakers sent here to sabotage our mission?

replies.text: The Shadow protects us.
Fine. I better not start a fight with the royal guard.

message: That does it. You better fight or flee right now kid.

replies.text: Good. I have been waiting for a fight!
For the Shadow!
Never mind. I was just kidding with you.
